questions.question: The ICC Cricket World Cup is held every 5 years.
The ICC T20 World Cup was first held in 2007.
The ICC World Test Championship features a points system where all Test matches count equally.
The ICC Champions Trophy was discontinued after the 2017 edition.
Australia has won the most ICC ODI World Cups (5 titles as of 2023).
The ICC Women's T20 World Cup has been held more frequently than the Men's T20 World Cup.
The first ICC World Test Championship final was played between India and New Zealand in 2021.
The ICC Under-19 World Cup is held biennially (every 2 years).
Sri Lanka is the only host nation to win the ICC Cricket World Cup (1996).
The ICC World Cup Super League determined qualification for the 2023 World Cup.
